<section id="engines">
  <h1>5) Engines (JavaScript)</h1>

  <h3>assets/js/style-engine.js</h3>
  <pre><code>export async function loadStylepacks(){
  const res = await fetch('./assets/data/stylepacks.json');
  return await res.json();
}
export function applyStylepack(doc, packsOrId, idMaybe){
  const isString = typeof packsOrId === 'string';
  const packId = isString ? packsOrId : idMaybe;
  const packs = isString ? null : packsOrId;
  doc.documentElement.setAttribute('data-stylepack', packId);
  if (!packs) return;
  const pack = packs.packs.find(p => p.id === packId);
  if (pack && pack.palette){
    const rs = getComputedStyle(doc.documentElement);
    doc.documentElement.style.setProperty('--accent', pack.palette[2] || rs.getPropertyValue('--accent'));
    doc.documentElement.style.setProperty('--accent-2', pack.palette[1] || rs.getPropertyValue('--accent-2'));
  }
}
</code></pre>

  <h3>assets/js/ambient-engine.js</h3>
  <pre><code>let AC=null,nodes=null,irLoaded=false; const defaultHz=528, fadeMs=800;
export async function ensureAudio(){
  if(AC) return AC;
  const Ctx=window.AudioContext||window.webkitAudioContext; AC=new Ctx();
  const osc=AC.createOscillator(), gain=AC.createGain(), master=AC.createGain();
  const low=AC.createBiquadFilter(); low.type='lowshelf'; low.frequency.value=80; low.gain.value=-3;
  const peak=AC.createBiquadFilter(); peak.type='peaking'; peak.frequency.value=2500; peak.Q.value=0.9; peak.gain.value=-4;
  const comp=AC.createDynamicsCompressor(); comp.threshold.value=-28; comp.knee.value=24; comp.ratio.value=2.2; comp.attack.value=.015; comp.release.value=.25;
  const convolver=AC.createConvolver();
  const limiter=AC.createDynamicsCompressor(); limiter.threshold.value=-4; limiter.knee.value=0; limiter.ratio.value=20; limiter.attack.value=.003; limiter.release.value=.15;
  gain.gain.value=0.0001; master.gain.value=.25; osc.type='sine'; osc.frequency.value=defaultHz; osc.start();
  osc.connect(gain); gain.connect(low); low.connect(peak); peak.connect(comp); comp.connect(convolver); convolver.connect(limiter); limiter.connect(master); master.connect(AC.destination);
  nodes={osc,gain,master,convolver}; return AC;
}
export async function loadIR(url='./assets/audio/ir/cathedral_small.wav'){
  if(!AC) await ensureAudio();
  try{ const buf=await (await fetch(url,{cache:'force-cache'})).arrayBuffer();
       AC.decodeAudioData(buf,(dec)=>{ nodes.convolver.buffer=dec; irLoaded=true; }); } catch{ irLoaded=false; }
}
function fadeTo(target,ms=fadeMs){
  const g=nodes.gain.gain, now=AC.currentTime; g.cancelScheduledValues(now);
  g.setValueAtTime(g.value,now); g.linearRampToValueAtTime(target, now+ms/1000);
}
export async function startTone(hz=defaultHz){
  if(!AC) await ensureAudio(); if(!irLoaded) await loadIR();
  nodes.osc.frequency.linearRampToValueAtTime(hz, AC.currentTime+.25); fadeTo(0.08);
}
export function stopTone(){ if(!AC) return; fadeTo(0.0001); }
export function setTone(hz=defaultHz){ if(!AC) return; nodes.osc.frequency.linearRampToValueAtTime(hz, AC.currentTime+.12); }
</code></pre>

  <h3>assets/js/cathedral-engine.js</h3>
  <pre><code>import {loadStylepacks, applyStylepack} from './style-engine.js';
import {ensureAudio, startTone, stopTone, setTone} from './ambient-engine.js';
import {mountPlaque} from './room-plaque.js';

async function loadStructure(){ const res=await fetch('./assets/data/structure.json'); return await res.json(); }
function resolveRoom(struct){
  const path=location.pathname.split('/').pop()||'index.html';
  const hash=location.hash||'';
  const exact = struct.rooms.find(r => (r.route === (path+hash)));
  if(exact) return exact;
  return struct.rooms.find(r=>r.route===path) || struct.rooms[0];
}
function mountOverlay(){ const ov=document.createElement('div'); ov.className='overlay-vitrail'; document.body.appendChild(ov); return ov; }

(async function boot(){
  const struct=await loadStructure(); const packs=await loadStylepacks();
  const room=resolveRoom(struct); applyStylepack(document, packs, room.stylepack);
  mountOverlay();
  const plaque=mountPlaque({ title: room.title, glyph: 'ìÇÄ', toneHz: room.toneHz, stylepack: room.stylepack, notes: room.notes });
  let audioOn=false, currentHz=room.toneHz||528;
  plaque.querySelector('#btnToggle').addEventListener('click', async ()=>{
    if(!audioOn){ await ensureAudio(); await startTone(currentHz); audioOn=true; } else { stopTone(); audioOn=false; }
  });
  plaque.querySelector('#btnToneUp').addEventListener('click', ()=>{ currentHz = Math.round((currentHz+6)); setTone(currentHz); });
  plaque.querySelector('#btnToneDown').addEventListener('click', ()=>{ currentHz = Math.max(60, Math.round((currentHz-6))); setTone(currentHz); });
})();
</code></pre>

            box-shadow: 0 10px 30px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5);
        }

        .repo-title {
            font-size: 1.3rem;
            color: var(--accent-gold);
            margin-bottom: 1rem;
            display: flex;
            align-items: center;
            gap: 0.5rem;
        }

        .repo-role {
            font-size: 0.9rem;
            color: var(--text-secondary);
            font-style: italic;
            margin-bottom: 0.5rem;
        }

        .repo-features {
            list-style: none;
            margin-top: 1rem;
        }

        .repo-features li {
            padding: 0.3rem 0;
            color: var(--text-secondary);
            position: relative;
            padding-left: 1.5rem;
        }

        .repo-features li::before {
            content: '‚ú¶';
            position: absolute;
            left: 0;
            color: var(--accent-gold);
        }

        .repo-link {
            display: inline-block;
            margin-top: 1rem;
            padding: 0.5rem 1rem;
            background: var(--bg-primary);
            border: 1px solid var(--accent-gold);
            border-radius: 4px;
            color: var(--accent-gold);
            text-decoration: none;
            transition: all var(--transition-speed) ease;
        }

        .repo-link:hover {
            background: var(--accent-gold);
            color: var(--bg-primary);
        }

        /* Tarot Grid */
        .tarot-section {
            grid-column: 1 / -1;
            margin: 3rem 0;
        }

        .tarot-grid {
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, minmax(150px, 1fr));
            gap: 1rem;
            margin-top: 2rem;
        }

        .tarot-card {
            aspect-ratio: 0.618;
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--bg-secondary), var(--bg-primary));
            border: 2px solid var(--border-color);
            border-radius: 8px;
            display: flex;
            flex-direction: column;
            align-items: center;
            justify-content: center;
            cursor: pointer;
            transition: all var(--transition-speed) ease;
            position: relative;
            overflow: hidden;
        }

        .tarot-card:hover {
            transform: rotateY(5deg) scale(1.05);
            border-color: var(--accent-gold);
            box-shadow: 0 5px 20px rgba(212, 175, 55, 0.3);
        }

        .tarot-number {
            font-size: 2rem;
            color: var(--accent-gold);
            font-weight: bold;
        }

        .tarot-name {
            font-size: 0.9rem;
            color: var(--text-secondary);
            text-align: center;
            padding: 0.5rem;
        }

        /* Constants Display */
        .constants-grid {
            grid-column: 1 / -1;
            display: flex;
            justify-content: space-around;
            flex-wrap: wrap;
            gap: 2rem;
            padding: 2rem;
            background: var(--bg-secondary);
            border-radius: 12px;
            margin: 2rem 0;
        }

        .constant-item {
            text-align: center;
        }

        .constant-number {
            font-size: 2rem;
            color: var(--accent-gold);
            font-weight: bold;
            display: block;
        }

        .constant-label {
            font-size: 0.9rem;
            color: var(--text-secondary);
            margin-top: 0.5rem;
        }

        /* Node System */
        .node-explorer {
            grid-column: 1 / -1;
            background: var(--bg-secondary);
            border-radius: 12px;
            padding: 2rem;
            margin: 2rem 0;
        }

        .node-grid {
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, minmax(200px, 1fr));
            gap: 1rem;
            margin-top: 1rem;
        }

        .node-item {
            padding: 1rem;
            background: var(--bg-primary);
            border: 1px solid var(--border-color);
            border-radius: 8px;
            cursor: pointer;
            transition: all var(--transition-speed) ease;
        }

        .node-item:hover {
            border-color: var(--accent-gold);
            transform: translateY(-2px);
        }

        .node-id {

            font-weight: bold;
        }

        .node-archetype {
            color: var(--text-secondary);
            font-size: 0.9rem;
            margin-top: 0.5rem;
        }

        /* Controls */
        .controls {
            grid-column: 1 / -1;
            display: flex;
            justify-content: center;
            gap: 1rem;
            margin: 2rem 0;
        }

        .control-btn {
            padding: 0.8rem 1.5rem;
            background: var(--bg-secondary);
            border: 1px solid var(--accent-gold);
            border-radius: 8px;
            color: var(--accent-gold);

            font-size: 1rem;
        }

        .control-btn:hover {
            background: var(--accent-gold);
            color: var(--bg-primary);
        }

        /* Footer */
        .footer {
            grid-column: 1 / -1;
            text-align: center;
            padding: 3rem 0;
            border-top: 1px solid var(--border-color);
            margin-top: 3rem;
            color: var(--text-secondary);
        }

        /* ND-Safe Animations */
        @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) {
            * {

            }
        }

        /* Responsive */

        // Initialize Tarot Grid

            { id: 20, name: "Judgement", archetype: "Gabriel" },
            { id: 21, name: "The World", archetype: "Sophia" }
        ];

        // Sample nodes
        const sampleNodes = [
            { id: "N00", name: "Aurora Gate", archetype: "Fool / Carrington" },
            { id: "N01", name: "Mercury Node", archetype: "Magician / Thoth" },
            { id: "N02", name: "Lunar Temple", archetype: "Priestess / Isis" },
            { id: "N03", name: "Venus Garden", archetype: "Empress / Aphrodite" },
            { id: "N08", name: "Solar Lion", archetype: "Strength / Sekhmet" },
            { id: "N13", name: "Death Portal", archetype: "Death / Kali" },
            { id: "N17", name: "Star Chamber", archetype: "Star / Nuit" },
            { id: "N21", name: "World Tree", archetype: "World / Yggdrasil" }
        ];

        // Populate Tarot Grid
        const tarotGrid = document.getElementById('tarotGrid');
        majorArcana.slice(0, 12).forEach(card => {
            const cardEl = document.createElement('div');
            cardEl.className = 'tarot-card';
            cardEl.innerHTML = `
                <span class="tarot-number">${card.id}</span>
                <span class="tarot-name">${card.name}</span>

            cardEl.onclick = () => activateCard(card);
            tarotGrid.appendChild(cardEl);
        });

        // Populate Node Grid
        const nodeGrid = document.getElementById('nodeGrid');
        sampleNodes.forEach(node => {

            nodeEl.innerHTML = `
                <div class="node-id">${node.id}</div>
                <div class="node-archetype">${node.archetype}</div>

            nodeEl.onclick = () => activateNode(node);
            nodeGrid.appendChild(nodeEl);
        });

        const perspectives = ['neutral', 'hermetic', 'kabbalistic', 'alchemical', 'taoist'];

            console.log(`Perspective shifted to: ${currentPerspective}`);
            alert(`Narrator perspective changed to: ${currentPerspective.toUpperCase()}`);

            console.log(`Card activated: ${card.name}`);
            alert(`‚ú¶ ${card.name} - ${card.archetype} activated ‚ú¶\nThe realm shifts...`);
        }

        function activateNode(node) {
            console.log(`Node activated: ${node.name}`);
            alert(`‚ú¶ Node ${node.id}: ${node.name} ‚ú¶\nArchetype: ${node.archetype}`);
        }

        console.log('Codex 144:99 loaded');
        console.log('ND-Safe mode: active');
        console.log('Sacred geometry: aligned');

<!DOCTYPE html>

        @import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Cinzel:wght@400;600&family=Cormorant+Garamond:ital,wght@0,400;1,400&display=swap');

        :root {
            --bg-abyss: #0a0e17;
            --text-luminous: #e8dcc4;
            --gold-alchemical: #d4af37;
            --purple-mystical: #6b3aa0;
            --blue-akashic: #2e4c8b;
            --red-rubedo: #8b2635;
            --green-viriditas: #2a5434;
            --silver-lunar: #c0c0c0;
        }

        * {
            margin: 0;
            padding: 0;
            box-sizing: border-box;
        }

        body {
            font-family: 'Cormorant Garamond', serif;
            background: var(--bg-abyss);
            color: var(--text-luminous);
            min-height: 100vh;
            overflow-x: hidden;
        }

        /* Geometric Canvas Background */
        .geometric-canvas {
            position: fixed;
            inset: 0;
            z-index: -1;
            opacity: 0.3;
        }

        .geometric-canvas::before,
        .geometric-canvas::after {
            content: '';
            position: absolute;
            top: 50%;
            left: 50%;
            width: 500px;
            height: 500px;
            transform: translate(-50%, -50%);
            border-radius: 50%;
            animation: sacred-rotation 60s linear infinite;
        }

        .geometric-canvas::before {
            border: 1px solid var(--gold-alchemical);
            box-shadow: 
                0 0 40px var(--gold-alchemical),
                inset 0 0 40px rgba(212, 175, 55, 0.2);
        }

        .geometric-canvas::after {
            border: 1px solid var(--purple-mystical);
            transform: translate(-50%, -50%) rotate(45deg);
            animation-direction: reverse;
            box-shadow: 
                0 0 40px var(--purple-mystical),
                inset 0 0 40px rgba(107, 58, 160, 0.2);
        }

        @keyframes sacred-rotation {
            to { transform: translate(-50%, -50%) rotate(360deg); }

```js
  res.json(hall);
});

});
```

```js
import http from 'http';
import { createRequire } from 'module';
const require = createRequire(import.meta.url);

const server = http.createServer((req, res) => {
  const url = new URL(req.url, `http://${req.headers.host}`);

  // Allow your GitHub Pages site
  res.setHeader('Access-Control-Allow-Origin', 'https://bekalah.github.io');
  res.setHeader('Content-Type', 'application/json');

  if (url.pathname === '/health') {
    res.writeHead(200);
    res.end('ok');
  } else if (url.pathname.startsWith('/v1/hall/')) {
    const id = url.pathname.split('/').pop().toLowerCase();
    const halls = require('./octagram_halls.json');
    const hall = halls[id];
    if (hall) {
      res.writeHead(200);
      res.end(JSON.stringify(hall));
    } else {
      res.writeHead(404);
      res.end(JSON.stringify({ error: 'Hall not found in Grimoire' }));
    }
  } else {
    res.writeHead(404);
    res.end(JSON.stringify({ error: 'Not found' }));
  }
});

const PORT = process.env.PORT || 8080;
server.listen(PORT, () => {
  console.log(`üúÅ Cathedral Atelier API running on ${PORT}`);
});
```

#### 2. `services/codex-engines/server.js`

```js
import http from 'http';
import { createRequire } from 'module';
const require = createRequire(import.meta.url);

const server = http.createServer((req, res) => {
  const url = new URL(req.url, `http://${req.headers.host}`);

  // ‚úÖ ONLY allow your GitHub Pages site
  res.setHeader('Access-Control-Allow-Origin', 'https://bekalah.github.io');
  res.setHeader('Content-Type', 'application/json');

  if (url.pathname === '/health') {
    res.writeHead(200);
    res.end('ok');
  } 
  else if (url.pathname.startsWith('/v1/hall/')) {
    const id = url.pathname.split('/').pop().toLowerCase();
    try {
      const halls = require('../data/octagram_halls.json');
      const hall = halls[id];
      if (hall) {
        res.writeHead(200);
        res.end(JSON.stringify(hall));
      } else {
        res.writeHead(404);
        res.end(JSON.stringify({ error: 'Hall not found in Grimoire' }));
      }
    } catch (e) {
      res.writeHead(500);
      res.end(JSON.stringify({ error: 'Data load failed' }));
    }
  }
  else {
    res.writeHead(404);
    res.end(JSON.stringify({ error: 'Not found' }));
  }
});

const PORT = process.env.PORT || 8080;
server.listen(PORT, () => {
  console.log(`üúÅ Codex Engines listening on ${PORT}`);
});
```

```js
import http from 'http';
import { createRequire } from 'module';
const require = createRequire(import.meta.url);

const server = http.createServer((req, res) => {
  const url = new URL(req.url, `http://${req.headers.host}`);

  // ‚úÖ ONLY allow your GitHub Pages site
  res.setHeader('Access-Control-Allow-Origin', 'https://bekalah.github.io');
  res.setHeader('Content-Type', 'application/json');

  if (url.pathname === '/health') {
    res.writeHead(200);
    res.end('ok');
  } 
  else if (url.pathname.startsWith('/v1/hall/')) {
    const id = url.pathname.split('/').pop().toLowerCase();
    try {
      // Load shared data (relative to monorepo root)
      const halls = require('../../apps/web/data/octagram_halls.json');
      const hall = halls[id];
      if (hall) {
        res.writeHead(200);
        res.end(JSON.stringify(hall));
      } else {
        res.writeHead(404);
        res.end(JSON.stringify({ error: 'Hall not found in Grimoire' }));
      }
    } catch (e) {
      res.writeHead(500);
      res.end(JSON.stringify({ error: 'Data load failed' }));
    }
  }
  else {
    res.writeHead(404);
    res.end(JSON.stringify({ error: 'Not found' }));
  }
});

const PORT = process.env.PORT || 8080;
server.listen(PORT, () => {
  console.log(`üúÅ stone-grimoire listening on ${PORT}`);
});
```

e the following command to authenticate to GitHub Packages in a GitHub Actions workflow using the GITHUB_TOKEN instead of hardcoding a personal access token in a nuget.config file in the repository:

### ASSISTANT
You're absolutely right to avoid hardcoding tokens‚Äîand your command is **almost correct**, but there are **two critical fixes** needed for it to work securely and reliably in a GitHub Actions workflow with **GitHub Packages (NuGet)**.

---

### ‚úÖ Corrected & Secure Command

```bash
dotnet nuget add source \
  --username ${{ github.actor }} \
  --password ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }} \
  --store-password-in-clear-text \
  --name github \
  "https://nuget.pkg.github.com/NAMESPACE/index.json"
```

---

### üîë Key Fixes Explained

1. **`USERNAME` ‚Üí `${{ github.actor }}`**  
   - `github.actor` is the **built-in GitHub Actions variable** for the user/actor triggering the workflow (e.g., `bekalah`).
   - Hardcoding a username breaks if someone else forks or triggers the workflow.
   - ‚úÖ **Always use `${{ github.actor }}`** in workflows.

2. **`NAMESPACE` ‚Üí your GitHub username or org name**  
   - Replace `NAMESPACE` with your actual GitHub username (e.g., `bekalah`) or organization name.
   - Example:  
     `"https://nuget.pkg.github.com/bekalah/index.json"`

---

### üõ°Ô∏è Why This Works
- `GITHUB_TOKEN` is **automatically provided** in every GitHub Actions workflow.
- It has **scoped permissions** to the current repo (no need for a PAT).
- `--store-password-in-clear-text` is **required** for `dotnet` CLI to work in headless CI environments (unfortunately, but safely scoped to the job).

---

### üìÅ Where to Use This
In your `.github/workflows/deploy.yml` (or a .NET build workflow):

```yaml
- name: Add GitHub Packages NuGet Source
  run: |
```

```ts
// Converts your .md research into structured JSON
import { readFileSync, writeFileSync } from 'fs';
import { join } from 'path';

function parseBibliography(): Record<string, any> {
  const content = readFileSync('data/bibliography.md', 'utf8');
  const nodes: Record<string, any> = {};
  
  // Parse lines like: Nodes: C144N-021 (Apprentice Pillar)
  const nodeRegex = /Nodes:\s+(C144N-\d+)\s+\(([^)]+)\)/g;
  let match;
  while ((match = nodeRegex.exec(content)) !== null) {
    const [_, id, name] = match;
    nodes[id] = { name, source: 'bibliography' };
  }
  return nodes;
}

// Run on `rush build`
writeFileSync(
  'apps/web/src/data/core_node_map.json',
  JSON.stringify(parseBibliography(), null, 2)
);
```

```ts
import { readFileSync, writeFileSync } from 'fs';

// Parse octagram_halls.md ‚Üí JSON
function parseOctagramHalls(): Record<string, any> {
  const content = readFileSync('data_source/octagram_halls.md', 'utf8');
  const halls: Record<string, any> = {};
  const hallBlocks = content.split('\n\n').filter(b => b.includes('Hall ‚Äî'));
  
  for (const block of hallBlocks) {
    const lines = block.split('\n').filter(l => l.trim());
    const nameLine = lines[0];
    const id = nameLine.split(' ')[0].toLowerCase();
    const archetype = lines.find(l => l.includes('Archetype:'))?.split(': ')[1] || '';
    const trial = lines.find(l => l.includes('Trial:'))?.split(': ')[1] || '';
    const lineage = archetype.split(' (')[0];
    
    // Map lineage to bibliography
    const constants = [144, 99];
    if (lineage.includes('Crowley')) constants.push(72);
    if (lineage.includes('Fortune')) constants.push(72);
    if (lineage.includes('Achad')) constants.push(99);
    if (lineage.includes('Tara')) constants.push(21);
    
    halls[id] = {
      name: nameLine,
      archetype,
      trial,
      witch_mode_gift: lines.find(l => l.includes('Witch-Mode Gift:'))?.split(': ')[1] || '',
      constants,
      lineage: [lineage]
    };
  }
  return halls;
}

// Parse bibliography.md ‚Üí node map
function parseBibliography(): Record<string, any> {
  const content = readFileSync('data_source/bibliography.md', 'utf8');
  const nodes: Record<string, any> = {};
  const nodeRegex = /Nodes: (C144N-\d+)/g;
  let match;
  while ((match = nodeRegex.exec(content)) !== null) {
    const id = match[1];
    const figure = content.substring(0, match.index).split('\n').pop()?.split(' ‚Äî ')[0] || '';
    nodes[id] = { figure, source: 'bibliography' };
  }
  return nodes;
}
```

```ts
import { readFileSync, writeFileSync } from 'fs';

// Parse octagram_halls.md ‚Üí JSON
function parseOctagramHalls() {
  const content = readFileSync('data_source/octagram_halls.md', 'utf8');
  const halls: Record<string, any> = {};
  const blocks = content.split('\n\n').filter(b => b.includes('Hall ‚Äî'));
  
  for (const block of blocks) {
    const lines = block.split('\n').filter(l => l.trim());
    const nameLine = lines[0];
    const id = nameLine.split(' ')[0].toLowerCase();
    const archetype = lines.find(l => l.includes('Archetype:'))?.split(': ')[1] || '';
    const trial = lines.find(l => l.includes('Trial:'))?.split(': ')[1] || '';
    const lineage = archetype.split(' (')[0];
    
    // Map lineage to constants from your research
    const constants = [144, 99];
    if (lineage.includes('Crowley')) constants.push(72);
    if (lineage.includes('Fortune')) constants.push(72);
    if (lineage.includes('Achad')) constants.push(99);
    if (lineage.includes('Tara')) constants.push(21);
    
    halls[id] = {
      name: nameLine,
      archetype,
      trial,
      witch_mode_gift: lines.find(l => l.includes('Witch-Mode Gift:'))?.split(': ')[1] || '',
      constants,
      lineage: [lineage]
    };
  }
  return halls;
}

// Parse bibliography.md ‚Üí node map
function parseBibliography() {
  const content = readFileSync('data_source/bibliography.md', 'utf8');
  const nodes: Record<string, any> = {};
  const regex = /Nodes: (C144N-\d+)/g;
  let match;
  while ((match = regex.exec(content)) !== null) {
    const id = match[1];
    const figure = content.substring(0, match.index).split('\n').pop()?.split(' ‚Äî ')[0] || '';
    nodes[id] = { figure, source: 'bibliography' };
  }
  return nodes;
}

// Build all data
const halls = parseOctagramHalls();
const nodes = parseBibliography();
const constants = [21, 33, 72, 78, 99, 144, 243];

writeFileSync('apps/web/data/octagram_halls.json', JSON.stringify(halls, null, 2));
writeFileSync('apps/web/data/core_node_map.json', JSON.stringify(nodes, null, 2));
writeFileSync('apps/web/data/fibonacci_constants.json', JSON.stringify({ constants }, null, 2));
```

### üìÑ 2. `synth/audio-engine.js` ‚Äî Web Audio Synth Core
```js
export class CodexSynth {
  constructor() {
    this.audioContext = new (window.AudioContext || window.webkitAudioContext)();
    this.oscillators = new Map();
    this.gainNode = this.audioContext.createGain();
    this.gainNode.connect(this.audioContext.destination);
    this.gainNode.gain.value = 0.3; // Trauma-safe volume
  }

  // Play a node as a harmonic chord
  playNode(nodeNumber, lineage = [], constants = []) {
    // Stop existing
    this.stopNode(nodeNumber);

    // Base frequency
    const baseFreq = SACRED_SCALES.nodeFrequency(nodeNumber);
    
    // Create base oscillator
    const baseOsc = this.createOscillator(baseFreq, 'sine');
    baseOsc.start();
    this.oscillators.set(`${nodeNumber}-base`, baseOsc);

    // Add lineage harmonics
    const harmonics = SACRED_SCALES.lineageHarmonics(lineage.join(' '));
    harmonics.forEach((h, i) => {
      const freq = baseFreq * (h / 72); // Scale by sacred ratio
      const osc = this.createOscillator(freq, 'triangle');
      osc.start();
      this.oscillators.set(`${nodeNumber}-h${i}`, osc);
    });

    // Add Solfeggio layer
    constants.forEach((c, i) => {
      const freq = SACRED_SCALES.solfeggioLayer(c);
      const osc = this.createOscillator(freq, 'sine');
      osc.frequency.value = freq;
      osc.start();
      this.oscillators.set(`${nodeNumber}-s${i}`, osc);
    });
  }

  createOscillator(freq, type = 'sine') {
    const osc = this.audioContext.createOscillator();
    const gain = this.audioContext.createGain();
    osc.type = type;
    osc.frequency.value = freq;
    gain.gain.value = 0.1;
    osc.connect(gain);
    gain.connect(this.gainNode);
    return osc;
  }

  stopNode(nodeNumber) {
    for (let [key, osc] of this.oscillators) {
      if (key.startsWith(`${nodeNumber}-`)) {
        osc.stop();
        this.oscillators.delete(key);
      }
    }
  }

  // ND-safe: no sudden sounds
  async resume() {
    if (this.audioContext.state === 'suspended') {
      await this.audioContext.resume();
    }
  }
}
```

```ts
export class SacredSynth {
  private audioContext: AudioContext;
  private oscillators: OscillatorNode[] = [];
  private filters: BiquadFilterNode[] = [];

  constructor(private hallConfig: any) {
    this.audioContext = new (window.AudioContext || (window as any).webkitAudioContext)();
  }

  // Play a note based on node number (1-144)
  playNode(nodeNumber: number, duration = 2) {
    const freq = this.hallConfig.frequency_base * (nodeNumber / 72);
    
    // Stop existing
    this.oscillators.forEach(osc => osc.stop());
    this.oscillators = [];

    // Create oscillators based on synth type
    for (let i = 0; i < (this.hallConfig.oscillators || 1); i++) {
      const osc = this.audioContext.createOscillator();
      const gain = this.audioContext.createGain();
      
      osc.type = 'sine';
      osc.frequency.value = freq * (1 + i * 0.5); // detune for richness
      gain.gain.value = 0.2;
      
      osc.connect(gain);
      gain.connect(this.audioContext.destination);
      
      osc.start();
      osc.stop(this.audioContext.currentTime + duration);
      this.oscillators.push(osc);
    }
  }

  // ND-safe: no sudden sounds
  async resume() {
    if (this.audioContext.state === 'suspended') {
      await this.audioContext.resume();
    }
  }
}
```

```ts
import { loadGLB } from '../webgpu';

export async function renderMinimoog(device: GPUDevice, context: GPUCanvasContext) {
  // Load 3D model (from jsDelivr CDN)
  const model = await loadGLB('https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/bekalah/cathedral@main/models/minimoog.glb');
  
  // Render with sacred geometry lighting
  const pipeline = device.createRenderPipeline({
    vertex: {
      module: device.createShaderModule({ code: vertexShader }),
      entryPoint: 'main'
    },
    fragment: {
      module: device.createShaderModule({ code: fragmentShader }),
      entryPoint: 'main',
      targets: [{ format: 'bgra8unorm' }]
    },
    primitive: { topology: 'triangle-list' }
  });
  
  // Draw with golden ratio proportions
  const commandEncoder = device.createCommandEncoder();
  const passEncoder = commandEncoder.beginRenderPass({
    colorAttachments: [{
      view: context.getCurrentTexture().createView(),
      clearValue: { r: 0.04, g: 0.04, b: 0.06, a: 1.0 },
      loadOp: 'clear',
      storeOp: 'store'
    }]
  });
  
  passEncoder.setPipeline(pipeline);
  passEncoder.draw(36); // Minimoog has 36 keys
  passEncoder.end();
  device.queue.submit([commandEncoder.finish()]);
}
```

javascriptimport express from 'express';
import cors from 'cors';
import { readFileSync } from 'fs';
import { fileURLToPath } from 'url';
import { dirname, join } from 'path';

const __dirname = dirname(fileURLToPath(import.meta.url));
const app = express();

// Load hall data
const hallData = JSON.parse(
  readFileSync(join(__dirname, '../data/octagram_halls.json'), 'utf-8')
);

// Configure CORS - only allow GitHub Pages
app.use(cors({
  origin: ['https://bekalah.github.io  ', 'http://localhost:3000'],
  optionsSuccessStatus: 200
}));

app.use(express.json());

// Health check
app.get('/health', (req, res) => {
  res.send('ok');
});

// Get all halls
app.get('/v1/halls', (req, res) => {
  res.json(hallData.halls);
});

// Get specific hall
app.get('/v1/hall/:id', (req, res) => {
  const hall = hallData.halls[req.params.id];
  if (hall) {
    res.json(hall);
  } else {
    res.status(404).json({ error: 'Hall not found' });
  }
});

// Root endpoint
app.get('/', (req, res) => {
  res.json({
    service: 'Cathedral Codex Engines',
    version: '1.0.0',
    endpoints: ['/v1/halls', '/v1/hall/:id', '/health']
  });
});

const PORT = process.env.PORT || 8080;
app.listen(PORT, () => {
  console.log(`Codex Engines running on port ${PORT}`);
});

# 8) AudioSigil component
cat > apps/web/src/app/components/AudioSigil.tsx << 'EOF'
"use client";
import { useEffect, useRef, useState } from "react";
import tones from "../../../../../registry/audio/sigil_tones.json";

type MapType = { version: string; map: Record<string, number[]> };

export default function AudioSigil({ token }: { token: string }) {
  const [playing, setPlaying] = useState(false);
  const ctxRef = useRef<AudioContext | null>(null);

  useEffect(() => {
    return () => {
      if (ctxRef.current) {
        ctxRef.current.close();
      }
    };
  }, []);

  async function play() {
    if (playing) return;
    setPlaying(true);
    
    const AC = (window.AudioContext || (window as any).webkitAudioContext);
    const ctx = new AC();
    ctxRef.current = ctx;
    const gain = ctx.createGain();
    gain.connect(ctx.destination);
    gain.gain.value = 0.08; // ND-safe level

    const list = (tones as MapType).map[token] || [396, 528, 639];
    let start = ctx.currentTime;
    
    for (const f of list) {
      const o = ctx.createOscillator();
      const g = ctx.createGain();
      o.type = "sine";
      o.frequency.value = f;
      o.connect(g);
      g.connect(gain);
      g.gain.setValueAtTime(0.0001, start);
      g.gain.exponentialRampToValueAtTime(0.2, start + 0.1);
      g.gain.exponentialRampToValueAtTime(0.0001, start + 1.6);
      o.start(start);
      o.stop(start + 1.7);
      start += 0.6; // overlapping, still soft
    }

    // auto stop marker
    setTimeout(() => setPlaying(false), (list.length * 600) + 1200);
  }

  return (
    <button 
      onClick={play} 
      aria-pressed={playing}
      style={{
        padding: "8px 12px",
        borderRadius: 10,
        border: "1px solid var(--line)",
        background: "rgba(255,255,255,.06)",
        color: "var(--text-1)",
        cursor: "pointer"
      }}
    >
      {playing ? "Playing Sigil Tones‚Ä¶" : "Play Sigil Tones"}
    </button>
  );
}
EOF

"use client";
import { useEffect, useState } from "react";

export default function SkinToggle() {
  const [codex, setCodex] = useState(false);
  
  useEffect(() => {
    document.documentElement.dataset.skin = codex ? "codex" : "";
  }, [codex]);
  
  return (
    <button 
      onClick={() => setCodex(v => !v)}
      style={{
        position: "fixed",
        right: 16,
        bottom: 16,
        padding: "8px 12px",
        borderRadius: 10,
        border: "1px solid var(--line)",
        background: "rgba(0,0,0,.06)",
        color: "var(--text-1)",
        cursor: "pointer"
      }}
    >
      {codex ? "Skin: Codex (On)" : "Skin: Codex (Off)"}
    </button>
  );
}

# 8) AudioSigil component
cat > apps/web/src/app/components/AudioSigil.tsx << 'EOF'
"use client";
import { useEffect, useRef, useState } from "react";
import tones from "../../../../../registry/audio/sigil_tones.json";

type MapType = { version: string; map: Record<string, number[]> };

export default function AudioSigil({ token }: { token: string }) {
  const [playing, setPlaying] = useState(false);
  const ctxRef = useRef<AudioContext | null>(null);

  useEffect(() => {
    return () => {
      if (ctxRef.current) {
        ctxRef.current.close();
      }
    };
  }, []);

  async function play() {
    if (playing) return;
    setPlaying(true);
    
    const AC = (window.AudioContext || (window as any).webkitAudioContext);
    const ctx = new AC();
    ctxRef.current = ctx;
    const gain = ctx.createGain();
    gain.connect(ctx.destination);
    gain.gain.value = 0.08; // ND-safe level

    const list = (tones as MapType).map[token] || [396, 528, 639];
    let start = ctx.currentTime;
    
    for (const f of list) {
      const o = ctx.createOscillator();
      const g = ctx.createGain();
      o.type = "sine";
      o.frequency.value = f;
      o.connect(g);
      g.connect(gain);
      g.gain.setValueAtTime(0.0001, start);
      g.gain.exponentialRampToValueAtTime(0.2, start + 0.1);
      g.gain.exponentialRampToValueAtTime(0.0001, start + 1.6);
      o.start(start);
      o.stop(start + 1.7);
      start += 0.6; // overlapping, still soft
    }

    // auto stop marker
    setTimeout(() => setPlaying(false), (list.length * 600) + 1200);
  }

  return (
    <button 
      onClick={play} 
      aria-pressed={playing}
      style={{
        padding: "8px 12px",
        borderRadius: 10,
        border: "1px solid var(--line)",
        background: "rgba(255,255,255,.06)",
        color: "var(--text-1)",
        cursor: "pointer"
      }}
    >
      {playing ? "Playing Sigil Tones‚Ä¶" : "Play Sigil Tones"}
    </button>
  );
}

      "id": "trial.floodflame-vow",
      "orderId": "order.flood-and-flame",
      "test": "Name two equal & opposite desires; hold both.",
      "success": "You do not exile either.",
      "reward": "+1 Alchemical Balance"
    }
  ]
}

        <defs>

            <stop offset="100%" stopColor="transparent"/>

"use client";
import { useEffect, useState } from "react";

export default function TraumaSafeToggle() {
  const [calm, setCalm] = useState(true);

  useEffect(() => {
    document.documentElement.dataset.calm = calm ? "1" : "0";
  }, [calm]);

  return (
    <button
      onClick={() => setCalm(!calm)}
      aria-pressed={calm}
      style={{
        position: "fixed",
        left: 16,
        bottom: 16,
        padding: "10px 14px",
        borderRadius: 999,
        border: "1px solid var(--line)",
        background: "rgba(255,255,255,.06)",
        color: "var(--text-2)",
        cursor: "pointer",
        backdropFilter: "blur(10px)",
      }}
    >
      {calm ? "Calm Mode: On" : "Calm Mode: Off"}
    </button>
  );
}

"use client";
import { useState } from "react";

type Mode = "ART" | "MUSIC" | "WISDOM" | "MUSEUM" | "SCIENCE";
const modes: Mode[] = ["ART", "MUSIC", "WISDOM", "MUSEUM", "SCIENCE"];

export default function ModeSwitch() {
  const [activeMode, setActiveMode] = useState<Mode>("ART");

  return (
    <nav style={{
      position: "fixed",
      top: 20,
      left: "50%",
      transform: "translateX(-50%)",
      display: "flex",
      gap: 12,
      padding: "8px 12px",
      backdropFilter: "blur(20px)",
      border: "1px solid var(--line)",
      borderRadius: 999,
      background: "rgba(20,22,26,.8)",
    }}>
      {modes.map((mode) => (
        <button
          key={mode}
          onClick={() => setActiveMode(mode)}
          style={{
            padding: "8px 12px",
            borderRadius: 999,
            border: "1px solid var(--line)",
            background: activeMode === mode ? "linear-gradient(135deg, var(--accent), var(--accent-2))" : "transparent",
            color: activeMode === mode ? "#000" : "var(--text-2)",
            cursor: "pointer",
          }}
        >
          {mode}
        </button>
      ))}
    </nav>
  );
}

on:

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup pnpm
        uses: pnpm/action-setup@v3
        with:
          version: 9

      - name: Setup Node
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: "20"
          cache: 'pnpm'

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: pnpm install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: Build with Next.js
        env:
          NEXT_PUBLIC_BASEPATH: /${{ github.event.repository.name }}
        run: |
          pnpm --filter web build

      - name: Upload artifact
        uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
        with:
          path: ./apps/web/out

  deploy:
    environment:
      name: github-pages
      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build
    steps:
      - name: Deploy to GitHub Pages
        id: deployment
        uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4

"use client";
import { useEffect, useRef, useState } from "react";
import tones from "../../../../../registry/audio/sigil_tones.json";

type MapType = { version: string; map: Record<string, number[]> };

export default function AudioSigil({ token }: { token: string }) {
  const [playing, setPlaying] = useState(false);
  const ctxRef = useRef<AudioContext | null>(null);

  useEffect(() => {
    return () => {
      if (ctxRef.current) {
        ctxRef.current.close();
      }
    };
  }, []);

  async function play() {
    if (playing) return;
    setPlaying(true);
    
    const AC = (window.AudioContext || (window as any).webkitAudioContext);
    const ctx = new AC();
    ctxRef.current = ctx;
    const gain = ctx.createGain();
    gain.connect(ctx.destination);
    gain.gain.value = 0.08; // ND-safe level

    const list = (tones as MapType).map[token] || [396, 528, 639];
    let start = ctx.currentTime;
    
    for (const f of list) {
      const o = ctx.createOscillator();
      const g = ctx.createGain();
      o.type = "sine";
      o.frequency.value = f;
      o.connect(g);
      g.connect(gain);
      g.gain.setValueAtTime(0.0001, start);
      g.gain.exponentialRampToValueAtTime(0.2, start + 0.1);
      g.gain.exponentialRampToValueAtTime(0.0001, start + 1.6);
      o.start(start);
      o.stop(start + 1.7);
      start += 0.6; // overlapping, still soft
    }

    // auto stop marker
    setTimeout(() => setPlaying(false), (list.length * 600) + 1200);
  }

  return (
    <button 
      onClick={play} 
      aria-pressed={playing}
      style={{
        padding: "8px 12px",
        borderRadius: 10,
        border: "1px solid var(--line)",
        background: "rgba(255,255,255,.06)",
        color: "var(--text-1)",
        cursor: "pointer"
      }}
    >
      {playing ? "Playing Sigil Tones‚Ä¶" : "Play Sigil Tones"}
    </button>
  );
}
EOF

/packages/kernel/merkaba.ts export type Vec3 = [number,number,number]; export type Vec4 = [number,number,number,number];
export const deg = (a:number)=> a*Math.PI/180;

export function projectTesseract(p:Vec4, theta=deg(28), phi=deg(18)): Vec3 {
  const [x,y,z,w]=p;
  const x1 =  x*Math.cos(theta) - w*Math.sin(theta);
  const w1 =  x*Math.sin(theta) + w*Math.cos(theta);
  const y1 =  y*Math.cos(phi)   - w1*Math.sin(phi);
  return [x1, y1, z];
}

export function merkabaVertices(scale=1): Vec3[] {
  const s=scale;
  const A:[number,number,number]=[ s, s, s], B=[ s,-s,-s], C=[-s, s,-s], D=[-s,-s, s];
  const AD:[number,number,number]=[-s,-s,-s], BD=[-s, s, s], CD=[ s,-s, s], DD=[ s, s,-s];
  return [A,B,C,D,AD,BD,CD,DD];
}

export function rotateY([x,y,z]:Vec3, a:number):Vec3{
  const c=Math.cos(a), s=Math.sin(a);
  return [x*c+z*s, y, -x*s+z*c];
}

export function antahkarana(progress:number, height=1):Vec3{
  return [0, progress*height, 0];
}

export function sacredFrame(t:number, scale=1){ 
  const core = merkabaVertices(scale).map(v => rotateY(v, t*0.25));
  const spine = antahkarana((Math.sin(t*0.2)+1)/2, scale*2.5);
  return { core, spine };

  ctx = new (window.AudioContext||(window as any).webkitAudioContext)();
  gain = this.ctx.createGain();
  constructor(){ this.gain.connect(this.ctx.destination); }
  playPartial(f:number, duration=2){
    const o=this.ctx.createOscillator(), g=this.ctx.createGain(), t=this.ctx.currentTime;
    o.type="sine"; o.frequency.value=f; o.connect(g); g.connect(this.gain);
    g.gain.setValueAtTime(0.0001,t);
    g.gain.exponentialRampToValueAtTime(0.25,t+0.08);
    g.gain.exponentialRampToValueAtTime(0.0001,t+duration);
    o.start(); o.stop(t+duration);
  }
}

import {useEffect,useRef} from "react";
import {sacredFrame} from "@kernel/merkaba";
export default function MerkabaCanvas(){
  const ref=useRef<HTMLCanvasElement>(null);
  useEffect(()=>{
    const cv=ref.current!, ctx=cv.getContext("2d")!;
    const DPR = Math.min(window.devicePixelRatio||1, 1.5);
    function resize(){ cv.width=innerWidth*DPR; cv.height=innerHeight*DPR; cv.style.width="100%"; cv.style.height="60vh"; }
    resize(); addEventListener("resize",resize);
    let t=0, raf=0;
    const draw=()=>{ t+=0.016; const {core,spine}=sacredFrame(t, 80);
      ctx.clearRect(0,0,cv.width,cv.height);
      ctx.save(); ctx.translate(cv.width/2, cv.height/2 - 40);
      // edges
      ctx.strokeStyle="rgba(255,255,255,.35)"; ctx.lineWidth=1.2;
      for(let i=0;i<core.length;i++) for(let j=i+1;j<core.length;j++){
        const [x1,y1]=core[i]; const [x2,y2]=core[j];
        ctx.beginPath(); ctx.moveTo(x1,y1); ctx.lineTo(x2,y2); ctx.stroke();
      }
      // spine
      ctx.fillStyle="rgba(212,175,55,.9)";
      ctx.beginPath(); ctx.arc(spine[0],spine[1]-80,4,0,Math.PI*2); ctx.fill();
      ctx.restore();
      raf=requestAnimationFrame(draw);
    }; draw();
    return ()=>{ cancelAnimationFrame(raf); removeEventListener("resize",resize); };
  },[]);
  return <canvas ref={ref} aria-label="Merkaba breathing spine"/>;

```js
// Tesseract ‚Üí Merkaba projection
export function projectTesseract(p, theta = 0.49, phi = 0.31) {
  const [x, y, z, w] = p;
  const x1 = x * Math.cos(theta) - w * Math.sin(theta);
  const w1 = x * Math.sin(theta) + w * Math.cos(theta);
  const y1 = y * Math.cos(phi) - w1 * Math.sin(phi);
  return [x1, y1, z];
}

export function merkabaVertices(scale = 1) {
  const s = scale;
  return [
    [s, s, s], [s, -s, -s], [-s, s, -s], [-s, -s, s],
    [-s, -s, -s], [-s, s, s], [s, -s, s], [s, s, -s]
  ];
}

export function rotateY([x, y, z], a) {
  const c = Math.cos(a), s = Math.sin(a);
  return [x * c + z * s, y, -x * s + z * c];
}

export function antahkarana(progress, height = 1) {
  return [0, progress * height, 0];
}

// Initialize Merkaba canvas
const canvas = document.getElementById('merkaba-canvas');
if (canvas) {
  const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
  const DPR = Math.min(window.devicePixelRatio || 1, 1.5);
  
  function resize() {
    canvas.width = innerWidth * DPR;
    canvas.height = (innerHeight * 0.6) * DPR;
    canvas.style.width = '100%';
    canvas.style.height = '60vh';
  }
  resize();
  window.addEventListener('resize', resize);
  
  let t = 0;
  function draw() {
    t += 0.016;
    const scale = 80;
    const core = merkabaVertices(scale).map(v => rotateY(v, t * 0.25));
    const spine = antahkarana((Math.sin(t * 0.2) + 1) / 2, scale * 2.5);
    
    ctx.clearRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);
    ctx.save();
    ctx.translate(canvas.width / 2, canvas.height / 2 - 40 * DPR);
    
    // Edges
    ctx.strokeStyle = 'rgba(255,255,255,.35)';
    ctx.lineWidth = 1.2;
    for (let i = 0; i < core.length; i++) {
      for (let j = i + 1; j < core.length; j++) {
        const [x1, y1] = core[i];
        const [x2, y2] = core[j];
        ctx.beginPath();
        ctx.moveTo(x1, y1);
        ctx.lineTo(x2, y2);
        ctx.stroke();
      }
    }
    
    // Spine (golden)
    ctx.fillStyle = 'rgba(212,175,55,.9)';
    ctx.beginPath();
    ctx.arc(spine[0], spine[1] - 80, 4, 0, Math.PI * 2);
    ctx.fill();
    
    ctx.restore();
    requestAnimationFrame(draw);
  }
  draw();
}
```

```js
export class HarmonicsPlayer {
  constructor() {
    this.ctx = new (window.AudioContext || window.webkitAudioContext)();
    this.gain = this.ctx.createGain();
    this.gain.connect(this.ctx.destination);
  }
  
  playPartial(frequency, duration = 3) {
    const oscillator = this.ctx.createOscillator();
    const gainNode = this.ctx.createGain();
    const startTime = this.ctx.currentTime;
    
    oscillator.type = 'sine';
    oscillator.frequency.value = frequency;
    oscillator.connect(gainNode);
    gainNode.connect(this.gain);
    
    gainNode.gain.setValueAtTime(0.0001, startTime);
    gainNode.gain.exponentialRampToValueAtTime(0.25, startTime + 0.08);
    gainNode.gain.exponentialRampToValueAtTime(0.0001, startTime + duration);
    
    oscillator.start();
    oscillator.stop(startTime + duration);
  }
}
```

"use client";
import { useEffect, useRef, useState } from "react";
import tones from "../../../../../registry/audio/sigil_tones.json";

type MapType = { version: string; map: Record<string, number[]> };

export default function AudioSigil({ token }: { token: string }) {
  const [playing, setPlaying] = useState(false);
  const ctxRef = useRef<AudioContext | null>(null);

  useEffect(() => {
    return () => {
      if (ctxRef.current) {
        ctxRef.current.close();
      }
    };
  }, []);

  async function play() {
    if (playing) return;
    setPlaying(true);
    
    const AC = (window.AudioContext || (window as any).webkitAudioContext);
    const ctx = new AC();
    ctxRef.current = ctx;
    const gain = ctx.createGain();
    gain.connect(ctx.destination);
    gain.gain.value = 0.08; // ND-safe level

    const list = (tones as MapType).map[token] || [396, 528, 639];
    let start = ctx.currentTime;
    
    for (const f of list) {
      const o = ctx.createOscillator();
      const g = ctx.createGain();
      o.type = "sine";
      o.frequency.value = f;
      o.connect(g);
      g.connect(gain);
      g.gain.setValueAtTime(0.0001, start);
      g.gain.exponentialRampToValueAtTime(0.2, start + 0.1);
      g.gain.exponentialRampToValueAtTime(0.0001, start + 1.6);
      o.start(start);
      o.stop(start + 1.7);
      start += 0.6; // overlapping, still soft
    }

    // auto stop marker
    setTimeout(() => setPlaying(false), (list.length * 600) + 1200);
  }

  return (
    <button 
      onClick={play} 
      aria-pressed={playing}
      style={{
        padding: "8px 12px",
        borderRadius: 10,
        border: "1px solid var(--line)",
        background: "rgba(255,255,255,.06)",
        color: "var(--text-1)",
        cursor: "pointer"
      }}
    >
      {playing ? "Playing Sigil Tones‚Ä¶" : "Play Sigil Tones"}
    </button>
  );
}
EOF

// Box breathing engine: inhale ‚Äî hold ‚Äî exhale ‚Äî hold
export type Phase = "inhale" | "hold1" | "exhale" | "hold2";
export type BoxPattern = { 
  inhale: number; 
  hold1: number; 
  exhale: number; 
  hold2: number; 
};

export const BOX_4x4: BoxPattern = { inhale: 4, hold1: 4, exhale: 4, hold2: 4 };
export const BOX_4_7_8: BoxPattern = { inhale: 4, hold1: 7, exhale: 8, hold2: 0 };

export interface Tick {
  phase: Phase;
  phaseElapsed: number;
  phaseTotal: number;
  cycleElapsed: number;
  cycleTotal: number;
  t: number; // 0..1 normalized phase progress
}

export class BoxBreather {
  pattern: BoxPattern;
  private _t0 = 0;
  private _paused = true;

  constructor(pattern: BoxPattern = BOX_4x4) {
    this.pattern = pattern;
  }

  setPattern(p: BoxPattern) { 
    this.pattern = p; 
  }
  
  start(now: number = performance.now()) { 
    this._t0 = now; 
    this._paused = false; 
  }
  
  pause() { 
    this._paused = true; 
  }
  
  resume(now: number = performance.now()) { 
    if (this._paused) { 
      this._t0 = now - this.elapsed(now); 
      this._paused = false; 
    } 
  }

  elapsed(now = performance.now()) { 
    return (now - this._t0) / 1000; 
  }

  next(now = performance.now()): Tick {
    const p = this.pattern;
    const totals = [p.inhale, p.hold1, p.exhale, p.hold2];
    const labels: Phase[] = ["inhale", "hold1", "exhale", "hold2"];
    const cycleTotal = totals.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0);
    const e = this.elapsed(now) % (cycleTotal || 1);
    let acc = 0;
    
    for (let i = 0; i < totals.length; i++) {
      const dur = totals[i];
      if (e < acc + dur || (dur === 0 && i === totals.length - 1)) {
        const phase = labels[i];
        const phaseElapsed = Math.max(0, e - acc);
        const phaseTotal = Math.max(0.0001, dur);
        const t = Math.min(1, phaseElapsed / phaseTotal);
        return { phase, phaseElapsed, phaseTotal, cycleElapsed: e, cycleTotal, t };
      }
      acc += dur;
    }
    
    return { 
      phase: "inhale", 
      phaseElapsed: e, 
      phaseTotal: totals[0] || 1, 
      cycleElapsed: e, 
      cycleTotal, 
      t: 0 
    };
  }
}
EOF

cat > packages/breath/useBoxBreath.ts << 'EOF'
"use client";
import * as React from "react";
import { BoxBreather, BOX_4x4, type Tick, type BoxPattern } from "./box";

export function useBoxBreath(pattern: BoxPattern = BOX_4x4, playing = true) {
  const ref = React.useRef(new BoxBreather(pattern));
  const [tick, setTick] = React.useState<Tick>(() => ref.current.next());

  React.useEffect(() => {
    ref.current.setPattern(pattern);
  }, [pattern]);

  React.useEffect(() => {
    let raf = 0;
    const loop = () => {
      setTick(ref.current.next());
      raf = requestAnimationFrame(loop);
    };
    if (playing) { 
      ref.current.start(); 
      raf = requestAnimationFrame(loop); 
    }
    return () => cancelAnimationFrame(raf);
  }, [playing]);

  return tick;
}
EOF

cat > packages/breath/chime.ts << 'EOF'
// Gentle metronome with WebAudio (very quiet, ND-safe)
export class BreathChime {
  ctx = new (window.AudioContext || (window as any).webkitAudioContext)();
  master = this.ctx.createGain();
  
  constructor() {
    this.master.gain.value = 0.08;
    this.master.connect(this.ctx.destination);
  }
  
  setCalm(isCalm: boolean) { 
    this.master.gain.value = isCalm ? 0.04 : 0.08; 
  }

  ping(freq = 432) {
    const t = this.ctx.currentTime;
    const o = this.ctx.createOscillator();
    const g = this.ctx.createGain();
    o.type = "sine";
    o.frequency.value = freq;
    o.connect(g);
    g.connect(this.master);
    g.gain.setValueAtTime(0.0001, t);
    g.gain.exponentialRampToValueAtTime(0.18, t + 0.04);
    g.gain.exponentialRampToValueAtTime(0.0001, t + 0.28);
    o.start();
    o.stop(t + 0.32);
  }
}
EOF

"use client";
import * as React from "react";
import { useBoxBreath } from "@cathedral/breath/useBoxBreath";
import { BOX_4x4, BOX_4_7_8 } from "@cathedral/breath/box";
import { BreathChime } from "@cathedral/breath/chime";

const isCalm = () => document.documentElement.dataset.calm === "1";

export default function BreathHUD({ 
  pattern = "4x4", 
  chimes = false 
}: {
  pattern?: "4x4" | "4-7-8";
  chimes?: boolean;
}) {
  const p = pattern === "4-7-8" ? BOX_4_7_8 : BOX_4x4;
  const tick = useBoxBreath(p, true);
  const [show, setShow] = React.useState(true);
  const chimer = React.useRef<BreathChime | null>(null);
  const lastPhase = React.useRef<string>("");

  React.useEffect(() => {
    if (!chimes) return;
    if (!chimer.current) chimer.current = new BreathChime();
    chimer.current.setCalm(isCalm());
  }, [chimes]);

  React.useEffect(() => {
    if (!chimes) return;
    if (tick.phase !== lastPhase.current) {
      lastPhase.current = tick.phase;
      const f = tick.phase.includes("hold") ? 324 : 432;
      chimer.current?.ping(f);
    }
  }, [tick.phase, chimes]);

  const size = 56;
  const stroke = 6;
  const r = (size - stroke) / 2;
  const c = 2 * Math.PI * r;
  const dash = c * tick.t;

  const phaseLabel = tick.phase === "hold1" || tick.phase === "hold2" ? "Hold" :
                     tick.phase === "inhale" ? "Inhale" : "Exhale";

  if (!show) return null;

  return (
    <div style={{
      position: "fixed",
      left: 16,
      top: 80,
      display: "grid",
      gap: 8,
      placeItems: "center",
      padding: "10px 12px",
      border: "1px solid var(--line)",
      borderRadius: 12,
      background: "rgba(20,22,28,.6)",
      backdropFilter: "blur(8px)",
      zIndex: 20
    }}>
      <svg width={size} height={size} viewBox={`0 0 ${size} ${size}`} 
           style={{ transform: "rotate(-90deg)" }}>
        <circle cx={size/2} cy={size/2} r={r} fill="none" 
                stroke="rgba(255,255,255,.15)" strokeWidth={stroke}/>
        <circle cx={size/2} cy={size/2} r={r} fill="none"
          stroke={tick.phase === "inhale" ? "var(--accent)" :
                  tick.phase === "exhale" ? "var(--accent-2)" : "var(--gold)"}
          strokeWidth={stroke} strokeLinecap="round"
          strokeDasharray={`${dash} ${c - dash}`} />
      </svg>
      <div style={{ fontSize: 12, opacity: .85 }}>
        {phaseLabel} ¬∑ {Math.ceil(tick.phaseTotal - tick.phaseElapsed)}s
      </div>
      <div style={{ display: "flex", gap: 8 }}>
        <button className="linkBtn" onClick={() => setShow(false)}>Hide</button>
        <button className="linkBtn" onClick={() => {
          const root = document.documentElement;
          root.dataset.calm = root.dataset.calm === "1" ? "0" : "1";
          chimer.current?.setCalm(isCalm());

```
## github-workflow.txt
```
# .github/workflows/deploy.yml
name: Deploy Cathedral to GitHub Pages

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  workflow_dispatch:

permissions:
  contents: read
  pages: write
  id-token: write

concurrency:
  group: "pages"
  cancel-in-progress: false

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup pnpm
        uses: pnpm/action-setup@v3
        with:
          version: 9

      - name: Setup Node
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: "20"
          cache: 'pnpm'

      - name: Setup Pages
        uses: actions/configure-pages@v4
        with:
          static_site_generator: next

      - name: Restore cache
        uses: actions/cache@v4
        with:
          path: |
            apps/web/.next/cache
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-nextjs-${{ hashFiles('**/pnpm-lock.yaml') }}-${{ hashFiles('**.[jt]s', '**.[jt]sx') }}
          restore-keys: |
            ${{ runner.os }}-nextjs-${{ hashFiles('**/pnpm-lock.yaml') }}-

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: pnpm install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: Build with Next.js
        env:
          NEXT_PUBLIC_BASEPATH: /${{ github.event.repository.name }}
        run: |
          cd apps/web
          pnpm build

      - name: Upload artifact
        uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
        with:
          path: ./apps/web/out

  deploy:
    environment:
      name: github-pages
      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build
    steps:
      - name: Deploy to GitHub Pages
        id: deployment
        uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4

how do i impmlement this to my code bot Unvalidated Redirects and Forwards Cheat Sheet¬∂
Introduction¬∂
Unvalidated redirects and forwards are possible when a web application accepts untrusted input that could cause the web application to redirect the request to a URL contained within untrusted input. By modifying untrusted URL input to a malicious site, an attacker may successfully launch a phishing scam and steal user credentials.

Because the server name in the modified link is identical to the original site, phishing attempts may have a more trustworthy appearance. Unvalidated redirect and forward attacks can also be used to maliciously craft a URL that would pass the application's access control check and then forward the attacker to privileged functions that they would normally not be able to access.

Safe URL Redirects¬∂
When we want to redirect a user automatically to another page (without an action of the visitor such as clicking on a hyperlink) you might implement a code such as the following:

Java

response.sendRedirect("http://www.mysite.com");
PHP

<?php
/* Redirect browser */
header("Location: http://www.mysite.com");
/* Exit to prevent the rest of the code from executing */
exit;
?>
ASP .NET

Response.Redirect("~/folder/Login.aspx")
Rails

redirect_to login_path
Rust actix web

  Ok(HttpResponse::Found()
        .insert_header((header::LOCATION, "https://mysite.com/  "))
        .finish())
In the examples above, the URL is being explicitly declared in the code and cannot be manipulated by an attacker.

Dangerous URL Redirects¬∂
The following examples demonstrate unsafe redirect and forward code.

Dangerous URL Redirect Example 1¬∂
The following Java code receives the URL from the parameter named url (GET or POST) and redirects to that URL:

response.sendRedirect(request.getParameter("url"));
The following PHP code obtains a URL from the query string (via the parameter named url) and then redirects the user to that URL. Additionally, the PHP code after this header() function will continue to execute, so if the user configures their browser to ignore the redirect, they may be able to access the rest of the page.

$redirect_url = $_GET['url'];
header("Location: " . $redirect_url);
A similar example of C# .NET Vulnerable Code:

string url = request.QueryString["url"];
Response.Redirect(url);
And in Rails:

redirect_to params[:url]
Rust actix web

  Ok(HttpResponse::Found()
        .insert_header((header::LOCATION, query_string.path.as_str()))
        .finish())
The above code is vulnerable to an attack if no validation or extra method controls are applied to verify the certainty of the URL. This vulnerability could be used as part of a phishing scam by redirecting users to a malicious site.

If no validation is applied, a malicious user could create a hyperlink to redirect your users to an unvalidated malicious website, for example:

 http://example.com/example.php?url=http://malicious.example.com
The user sees the link directing to the original trusted site (example.com) and does not realize the redirection that could take place

Dangerous URL Redirect Example 2¬∂
ASP .NET MVC 1 & 2 websites are particularly vulnerable to open redirection attacks. In order to avoid this vulnerability, you need to apply MVC 3.

The code for the LogOn action in an ASP.NET MVC 2 application is shown below. After a successful login, the controller returns a redirect to the returnUrl. You can see that no validation is being performed against the returnUrl parameter.

ASP.NET MVC 2 LogOn action in AccountController.cs (see Microsoft Docs link provided above for the context):

   }

   // If we got this far, something failed, redisplay form
   return View(model);
 }
Dangerous Forward Example¬∂
When applications allow user input to forward requests between different parts of the site, the application must check that the user is authorized to access the URL, perform the functions it provides, and it is an appropriate URL request.

If the application fails to perform these checks, an attacker crafted URL may pass the application's access control check and then forward the attacker to an administrative function that is not normally permitted.

Example:

http://www.example.com/function.jsp?fwd=admin.jsp
The following code is a Java servlet that will receive a GET request with a URL parameter named fwd in the request to forward to the address specified in the URL parameter. The servlet will retrieve the URL parameter value from the request and complete the server-side forward processing before responding to the browser.

public class ForwardServlet extends HttpServlet
{
  protected void doGet(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response)
                    throws ServletException, IOException {
    String query = request.getQueryString();
    if (query.contains("fwd"))
    {
      String fwd = request.getParameter("fwd");
      try
      {
        request.getRequestDispatcher(fwd).forward(request, response);
      }
      catch (ServletException e)
      {
        e.printStackTrace();
      }
    }
  }
}
Preventing Unvalidated Redirects and Forwards¬∂
Safe use of redirects and forwards can be done in a number of ways:

Simply avoid using redirects and forwards.
If used, do not allow the URL as user input for the destination.
Where possible, have the user provide short name, ID or token which is mapped server-side to a full target URL.
This provides the highest degree of protection against the attack tampering with the URL.
Be careful that this doesn't introduce an enumeration vulnerability where a user could cycle through IDs to find all possible redirect targets
If user input can‚Äôt be avoided, ensure that the supplied value is valid, appropriate for the application, and is authorized for the user.
Sanitize input by creating a list of trusted URLs (lists of hosts or a regex).
This should be based on an allow-list approach, rather than a denylist.
Force all redirects to first go through a page notifying users that they are going off of your site, with the destination clearly displayed, and have them click a link to confirm.
Validating URLs¬∂
Validating and sanitising user-input to determine whether the URL is safe is not a trivial task. Detailed instructions how to implement URL validation is described in Server Side Request Forgery Prevention Cheat Sheet

References¬∂
CWE Entry 601 on Open Redirects.
WASC Article on URL Redirector Abuse
Google blog article on the dangers of open redirects.
Preventing Open Redirection Attacks (C#).


### ASSISTANT
To **secure your code against Unvalidated Redirects and Forwards**, you should **never directly use user-supplied input** (like query parameters) as the destination for a redirect or forward **without validation**.

Below is a practical, language-specific guide showing **how to implement safe redirects** based on the OWASP cheat sheet you provided.

---

## ‚úÖ General Principles (Apply to All Languages)

1. **Avoid user-controlled redirects if possible.**
2. **If you must redirect based on user input:**
   - Use an **allowlist** of valid destinations (e.g., internal paths or trusted domains).
   - **Never** redirect to arbitrary external URLs.
   - **Validate** the URL strictly (e.g., check host, path, scheme).
3. **For forwards**, ensure the target is internal and the user is authorized.
4. **Prefer relative paths** or **named routes** over raw URLs.
5. **Warn users** before redirecting off-site (optional but user-friendly).

---

## üîí Language-Specific Safe Implementations

### ‚úÖ Java (Servlet / Spring)

#### ‚ùå Vulnerable:
```java
response.sendRedirect(request.getParameter("url"));
```

#### ‚úÖ Safe (Allowlist of internal paths):
```java
String url = request.getParameter("url");

// Only allow relative paths or specific trusted paths
if (url != null && (url.startsWith("/") || url.matches("^/dashboard|/profile|/logout$"))) {
    response.sendRedirect(url);
} else {
    response.sendRedirect("/"); // fallback
}
```

#### ‚úÖ Even better: Use a mapping
```java
Map<String, String> redirectMap = Map.of(
    "dashboard", "/user/dashboard",
    "profile", "/user/profile"
);

String target = request.getParameter("to");
String safeUrl = redirectMap.getOrDefault(target, "/");
response.sendRedirect(safeUrl);
```

> **Note**: For forwards (`RequestDispatcher`), only allow internal JSPs with strict validation.

---

### ‚úÖ PHP

#### ‚ùå Vulnerable:
```php
header("Location: " . $_GET['url']);
```

#### ‚úÖ Safe (Allowlist of internal paths):
```php
$allowed = ['/dashboard', '/profile', '/logout'];
$redirect = $_GET['url'] ?? '/';

if (in_array($redirect, $allowed)) {
    header("Location: " . $redirect);
    exit;
} else {
    header("Location: /");
    exit;
}
```

#### ‚úÖ Or use a token-to-URL map:
```php
$routes = [
    'home' => '/',
    'dash' => '/dashboard'
];

$token = $_GET['r'] ?? 'home';
$url = $routes[$token] ?? '/';
header("Location: $url");
exit;
```

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Always `exit` after `header()` to prevent further execution.

---

### ‚úÖ ASP.NET (C#)

#### ‚ùå Vulnerable:
```csharp
string url = Request.QueryString["returnUrl"];
Response.Redirect(url);
```

#### ‚úÖ Safe (Use `Url.IsLocalUrl`):
```csharp
public ActionResult LogOn(LogOnModel model, string returnUrl)
{
    if (ModelState.IsValid && MembershipService.ValidateUser(model.UserName, model.Password))
    {
        FormsService.SignIn(model.UserName, model.RememberMe);
        
        if (!string.IsNullOrEmpty(returnUrl) && Url.IsLocalUrl(returnUrl))
        {
            return Redirect(returnUrl);
        }
        return RedirectToAction("Index", "Home");
    }
    return View(model);
}
```

> ‚úÖ `Url.IsLocalUrl()` (built into ASP.NET MVC) checks that the URL is **local to the app** (no external domains).

---

### ‚úÖ Ruby on Rails

#### ‚ùå Vulnerable:
```ruby
redirect_to params[:url]
```

#### ‚úÖ Safe (Use `redirect_back` or allowlist):
```ruby
# Option 1: Only allow relative paths
url = params[:url]
if url&.start_with?('/') && !url.start_with?('//') && URI.parse(url).host.nil?
  redirect_to url
else
  redirect_to root_path
end
```

#### ‚úÖ Better: Use stored return paths or named routes
```ruby
# In session or form
session[:return_to] ||= request.referer

# After login
redirect_to(session.delete(:return_to) || root_path)
```

> Rails also provides `redirect_back(fallback_location: root_path)`.

---

### ‚úÖ Rust (Actix Web)

#### ‚ùå Vulnerable:
```rust
Ok(HttpResponse::Found()
    .insert_header((header::LOCATION, query.path.as_str()))
    .finish())
```

#### ‚úÖ Safe (Validate host or use allowlist):
```rust
use url::Url;

fn is_safe_redirect(url_str: &str) -> bool {
    match Url::parse(url_str) {
        Ok(url) => {
            // Only allow your own domain or relative paths
            matches!(url.host_str(), Some("yourdomain.com") | None) &&
            url.scheme() == "https" // or "http" in dev
        }
        Err(_) => false,
    }
}

// In handler
let redirect_url = query.get("url").unwrap_or("/");
if is_safe_redirect(redirect_url) {
    HttpResponse::Found()
        .insert_header((header::LOCATION, redirect_url))
        .finish()
} else {
    HttpResponse::Found()
        .insert_header((header::LOCATION, "/"))
        .finish()
}
```

> Use the `url` crate for robust parsing.

---

### ‚úÖ General Validation Helper (Pseudocode)

If you **must** accept external URLs (e.g., OAuth callbacks), **strictly validate**:

```python
def is_safe_url(url):
    # Parse URL
    parsed = urlparse(url)
    
    # Block if:
    if parsed.scheme not in ('https', ''):  # allow relative (no scheme)
        return False
    if parsed.netloc and parsed.netloc not in ('yourdomain.com', 'trusted.partner.com'):
        return False
    if parsed.path.startswith('//'):  # avoid //evil.com
        return False
        
    return True
```

> Never use a **blocklist** (e.g., "block javascript:"). Use an **allowlist**.

---

## üõ°Ô∏è Additional Protections

- **Log all redirects** for monitoring.
- **Use Content Security Policy (CSP)** to reduce impact of phishing.
- **Add user confirmation** for off-site redirects:
  ```html
  You are being redirected to: <strong>https://external.com</strong>
  <a href="https://external.com">Click to continue</a>
  ```

---

## üîö Summary

| Approach | Security Level |
|--------|----------------|
| Hardcoded URLs | ‚úÖ‚úÖ‚úÖ Safe |
| Allowlist of paths/tokens | ‚úÖ‚úÖ Safe |
| Validate host/scheme | ‚úÖ Acceptable (if done right) |
| Direct user input | ‚ùå Dangerous |

> üîë **Best Practice**: **Never trust user input for redirects**. Map tokens to URLs server-side.

By following these patterns, you eliminate open redirect vulnerabilities while maintaining functionality.

## ‚úÖ Step 6: **Fix Lighthouse Workflow (`lighthouse.yml`)**

Your GitHub Actions likely fails due to **missing permissions or base path**.

### üõ†Ô∏è Create `.github/workflows/lighthouse.yml`:

```yaml
name: Lighthouse Audit
on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  lighthouse:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: read
      pages: write
      id-token: write
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Node
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '20'
          cache: 'pnpm'

      - name: Install Rush
        run: npm install -g @microsoft/rush

      - name: Build Monorepo
        run: rush build

      - name: Serve & Audit
        run: |
          npx serve -s apps/web/public --listen 8080 &
          sleep 3
          npx lighthouse http://localhost:8080/Codex14499.html \
            --output html \
            --output-path ./lighthouse-report.html \
            --quiet --chrome-flags="--headless"

      - name: Upload Report
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: lighthouse-report
          path: ./lighthouse-report.html
```

> üîë Key fixes:
> - `permissions` block added (required for GitHub Actions in 2025)
> - Serves from `apps/web/public` (your actual deploy folder)
> - Uses `Codex14499.html` as entry point

```ts
window['loadHall'] = async (id: string) => {
  const hall = halls[id];
  if (!hall) return;

  // Hide threshold
  const threshold = document.querySelector('.threshold');
  if (threshold) threshold.style.opacity = '0';

  statusEl!.textContent = `Entering ${hall.name}...`;

  // If it's a legacy hall (fool, tower, etc.), render geometry
  if (!['liber-arcanae', 'stone-grimoire', 'codex-1499'].includes(id)) {
    const ratio = hall.constants[0] / hall.constants[1];
    await renderVesicaPiscis(device, context, ratio);
    try {
      const res = await fetch(`https://cosmogenesis-learning-engine.fly.dev/v1/hall/${id}`);
      const data = await res.json();
      statusEl!.textContent = `${hall.name} ‚Äî ${data.lineage.join(' ‚Ä¢ ')}`;
    } catch (e) {
      statusEl!.textContent = `${hall.name} (offline)`;
    }
    return;
  }

  // For Liber Arcanae, Stone Grimoire, Codex 1499: full-screen iframe portal
  document.body.innerHTML = `
```

## ‚úÖ Step 1: Add Fractal Geometry per Node

### üî¢ Numerology ‚Üí Fractal Rules
Each node `n` (0‚Äì144) has:
- **Base angle**: `(n / 144) * 360¬∞`
- **Recursive depth**: `Math.min(5, Math.floor(n / 20))`
- **Color**: mapped from sacred constants (`21, 33, 72, 78, 99, 144, 243`)

### üé® Update `apps/web/src/engine/geometry.ts`:

```ts
export function generateNodeFractal(ctx: CanvasRenderingContext2D, node: number, width: number, height: number) {
  const centerX = width / 2;
  const centerY = height / 2;
  const baseRadius = Math.min(width, height) * 0.3;
  const depth = Math.min(5, Math.floor(node / 20));
  const angleStep = (node / 144) * Math.PI * 2;

  ctx.clearRect(0, 0, width, height);
  drawFractalBranch(ctx, centerX, centerY, baseRadius, angleStep, depth, node);
}

function drawFractalBranch(ctx: CanvasRenderingContext2D, x: number, y: number, radius: number, angle: number, depth: number, node: number) {
  if (depth <= 0 || radius < 2) return;

  const endX = x + Math.cos(angle) * radius;
  const endY = y + Math.sin(angle) * radius;

  // Color by sacred constant
  const isSacred = FIBONACCI_CONSTANTS.includes(node);
  ctx.strokeStyle = isSacred ? '#d4af37' : `hsl(${(node * 137.5) % 360}, 80%, 60%)`;
  ctx.lineWidth = Math.max(0.5, radius / 20);
  ctx.beginPath();
  ctx.moveTo(x, y);
  ctx.lineTo(endX, endY);
  ctx.stroke();

  // Recurse with golden ratio
  const newRadius = radius * 0.618;
  drawFractalBranch(ctx, endX, endY, newRadius, angle + 0.5, depth - 1, node);
  drawFractalBranch(ctx, endX, endY, newRadius, angle - 0.5, depth - 1, node);
}
```

```ts
canvas.addEventListener('click', (e) => {
  const rect = canvas.getBoundingClientRect();
  const x = e.clientX - rect.left;
  const y = e.clientY - rect.top;
  const centerX = canvas.width / 2;
  const centerY = canvas.height / 2;
  const dx = x - centerX;
  const dy = y - centerY;
  const distance = Math.sqrt(dx*dx + dy*dy);
  const radius = Math.min(centerX, centerY) - 100;

  if (distance < radius + 20 && distance > radius - 20) {

    const nodeIndex = Math.round(((angle + Math.PI) / (Math.PI * 2)) * 144) % 144;
    window['enterAtelier'](nodeIndex + 1); // 1‚Äì144
  }
});
```

## ‚úÖ Step 2: Build the **Fractal Synth Engine** (`apps/web/src/engine/fractal-synth.ts`)

```ts
import { FIBONACCI_CONSTANTS } from '@cathedral/atelier-protocol';

export class FractalSynth {
  private canvas: HTMLCanvasElement;
  private ctx: CanvasRenderingContext2D;
  private node: any;
  private audioContext: AudioContext | null = null;
  private oscillator: OscillatorNode | null = null;

  constructor(canvas: HTMLCanvasElement, nodeData: any) {
    this.canvas = canvas;
    this.ctx = canvas.getContext('2d')!;
    this.node = nodeData;
    this.resize();
    window.addEventListener('resize', () => this.resize());
  }

  resize() {
    this.canvas.width = window.innerWidth;
    this.canvas.height = window.innerHeight;
  }

  start() {
    this.draw();
    this.startAudio();
  }

  draw() {
    const { geometry, fractal, color } = this.node.synth;
    this.ctx.clearRect(0, 0, this.canvas.width, this.canvas.height);

    switch (geometry) {
      case 'kunz-harmonograph':
        this.drawHarmonograph(fractal.params);
        break;
      case 'mandala':
        this.drawMandala(fractal.params);
        break;
      // Add more as needed
    }
  }

  drawHarmonograph(p: any) {
    const centerX = this.canvas.width / 2;
    const centerY = this.canvas.height / 2;
    const points = [];

    for (let t = 0; t < 500; t += 0.5) {
      const x = p.a1 * Math.sin(p.f1 * t + p.phi1 || 0) * Math.exp(-p.d1 * t) +
                p.a2 * Math.sin(p.f2 * t + p.phi2 || 0) * Math.exp(-p.d2 * t);
      const y = p.a3 * Math.sin(p.f3 * t + p.phi3 || 0) * Math.exp(-p.d3 * t) +
                p.a4 * Math.sin(p.f4 * t + p.phi4 || 0) * Math.exp(-p.d4 * t);
      points.push({ x: centerX + x * 80, y: centerY + y * 80 });
    }

    this.ctx.strokeStyle = this.getHarmonographColor();
    this.ctx.lineWidth = 1.2;
    this.ctx.beginPath();
    points.forEach((p, i) => {
      if (i === 0) this.ctx.moveTo(p.x, p.y);
      else this.ctx.lineTo(p.x, p.y);
    });
    this.ctx.stroke();
  }

  getHarmonographColor(): string {
    const { palette } = this.node.synth.color;
    if (palette === 'afk-spiritual') return 'hsla(220, 80%, 70%, 0.8)';
    if (palette === 'kunz-healing') return 'hsla(45, 100%, 70%, 0.9)';
    return '#d4af37';
  }

  startAudio() {
    if (this.audioContext) return;
    this.audioContext = new (window.AudioContext || (window as any).webkitAudioContext)();
    const { baseFreq, modulation } = this.node.synth.audio;

    this.oscillator = this.audioContext.createOscillator();
    this.oscillator.type = 'sine';
    this.oscillator.frequency.setValueAtTime(baseFreq, this.audioContext.currentTime);
    this.oscillator.connect(this.audioContext.destination);
    this.oscillator.start();
  }

  stop() {
    this.oscillator?.stop();
    this.audioContext?.close();
  }
}
```

```js
export function renderSoyga(ctx, params) {
  const { size = 36, seed = 'A', iterations = 7 } = params;
  const cellSize = Math.min(ctx.canvas.width, ctx.canvas.height) / size;
  ctx.fillStyle = '#d4af37';
  ctx.font = `${cellSize * 0.6}px monospace`;
  ctx.textAlign = 'center';
  ctx.textBaseline = 'middle';

  // Generate Soyga grid (simplified)
  for (let y = 0; y < size; y++) {
    for (let x = 0; x < size; x++) {
      const char = String.fromCharCode(65 + ((x * y + seed.charCodeAt(0)) % 26));
      ctx.fillText(char, x * cellSize + cellSize/2, y * cellSize + cellSize/2);
    }
  }
}
```

```js
export function renderIChing(ctx, params) {
  const { hexagram = 1, depth = 6 } = params;
  const centerX = ctx.canvas.width / 2;
  const centerY = ctx.canvas.height / 2;
  const radius = Math.min(centerX, centerY) * 0.8;

  // Draw hexagram lines (yin/yang)
  const lines = hexagramToLines(hexagram); // [1,1,1,1,1,1] for Qian
  lines.forEach((line, i) => {
    const angle = (i / 6) * Math.PI * 2 - Math.PI / 2;
    const r = radius * (1 - i / 6);
    const x1 = centerX + Math.cos(angle) * r;
    const y1 = centerY + Math.sin(angle) * r;
    const x2 = centerX + Math.cos(angle + Math.PI) * r;
    const y2 = centerY + Math.sin(angle + Math.PI) * r;

    ctx.strokeStyle = line ? '#d4af37' : '#7c4dff';
    ctx.lineWidth = line ? 4 : 2;
    ctx.beginPath();
    ctx.moveTo(x1, y1);
    ctx.lineTo(x2, y2);
    ctx.stroke();
  });
}
```

```js
  const height = ctx.canvas.height;

  // Draw paths (22)
  const paths = [[0,1],[0,2],[1,2],[1,4],[2,5],[4,6],[5,6],[6,7],[6,8],[7,9],[8,9]];
  ctx.strokeStyle = '#7c4dff';
  ctx.lineWidth = 1;
  paths.forEach(([a,b]) => {
    const [x1, y1] = [positions[a][0]*width, positions[a][1]*height];
    const [x2, y2] = [positions[b][0]*width, positions[b][1]*height];
    ctx.beginPath();
    ctx.moveTo(x1, y1);
    ctx.lineTo(x2, y2);
    ctx.stroke();
  });

  // Draw Sephiroth
  ctx.fillStyle = '#d4af37';
  positions.forEach(([x,y]) => {
    ctx.beginPath();
    ctx.arc(x*width, y*height, 8, 0, Math.PI*2);
    ctx.fill();
  });
}
```

## üìÑ 5. `fractals/reiki.js` ‚Äî Raku/Fusion Reiki Energy Flow
```js
export function renderRakuReiki(ctx, params) {
  const { chakras = 7, shamanic_layers = 3 } = params;
  const centerX = ctx.canvas.width / 2;
  const centerY = ctx.canvas.height / 2;
  const maxRadius = Math.min(centerX, centerY) * 0.9;

  // Draw chakra vortices
  const colors = ['#FF0000', '#FF7F00', '#FFFF00', '#00FF00', '#0000FF', '#4B0082', '#9400D3'];
  for (let i = 0; i < chakras; i++) {
    const radius = maxRadius * (i + 1) / chakras;
    const color = colors[i] || '#d4af37';
    const alpha = 0.3 + (i / chakras) * 0.4;

    // Spiral flow (shamanic journey)
    ctx.strokeStyle = color;
    ctx.globalAlpha = alpha;
    ctx.lineWidth = 2;
    ctx.beginPath();
    for (let a = 0; a < Math.PI * 4; a += 0.1) {
      const r = radius * (a / (Math.PI * 4));
      const x = centerX + Math.cos(a) * r;
      const y = centerY + Math.sin(a) * r;
      if (a === 0) ctx.moveTo(x, y);
      else ctx.lineTo(x, y);
    }
    ctx.stroke();
  }
  ctx.globalAlpha = 1.0;
}
```

### üìÑ **Step 4: Web Audio Engine (`public/harmonics/player.js`)**
```js
export function playTone(frequency, duration = 3) {
  const ctx = new (window.AudioContext || window.webkitAudioContext)();
  const gain = ctx.createGain();
  const osc = ctx.createOscillator();
  osc.type = 'sine';
  osc.frequency.value = frequency;
  gain.gain.value = 0.1; // ND-safe volume
  osc.connect(gain);
  gain.connect(ctx.destination);
  const start = ctx.currentTime;
  gain.gain.setValueAtTime(0.0001, start);
  gain.gain.exponentialRampToValueAtTime(0.25, start + 0.08);
  gain.gain.exponentialRampToValueAtTime(0.0001, start + duration);
  osc.start();
  osc.stop(start + duration);
}
```
